div.h2: Important Information for Charter Public Schools
div.p: The Center for Charter Schools has partnered with MAPSA and the Michigan Council of Charter School Authorizers to provide CMU partner schools with information and resources during this challenging time.
“To transform public education through accountability, innovation and access to quality education for all students”
CMU was the first university in the nation to authorize a charter public school and has remained a national leader in authorizing since 1994.
CMU partner schools provide quality educational options to students throughout Michigan.
CMU partners with 57 schools providing a diverse portfolio of educational options to families.
The board members that serve CMU partner schools are committed to public service and are dedicated to providing a quality education to students.

The Center provides experience, expertise, commitment and knowledge that allows CMU partner schools to stay focused on what is most important, ensuring that all students have access to quality education options.

img.div: Providing resources and professional development that assist board members in fulfilling their public service commitments.
Sharing useful information with school administrators on academic, fiscal and compliance matters affecting their school.
Seeking new partners that share our vision of providing quality educational options to students in Michigan.
Driving collaboration by sharing the Center’s best practices including national conference presentations.

div.p: The Center offers a wide range of professional development opportunities for board members and school leaders. The events held across the state, provide the tools and resources needed to further develop leadership skills and meet the needs of an ever-changing educational landscape.
